subject: AI & Agents
title: Instruction Tuning: Teaching Models to Follow Orders
description: A quick win: understand Instruction Tuning: Teaching Models to Follow Orders.

hook.text: Base GPT-3 rambles endlessly. Instruction-tuned GPT-3.5 answers questions precisely. What changed?

buildup.text: Instruction tuning fine-tunes base models on prompt-response pairs to follow user instructions.

discovery.text: RLHF and DPO further align outputs with human preferences for helpfulness and safety.

twist.text: Instruction tuning sacrifices some creativity for reliability. The base model is wilder but less useful.

climax.text: The instruction-tuned version is what users interact with. The base model is the foundation.

punchline.text: Raw knowledge is useless without the ability to follow directions.

quiz.question: What does instruction tuning achieve?
options: It teaches models to follow user instructions reliably
